intro: Alloispermum caracasanum, commonly known as the Caracasanum spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and produces small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive shape, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Alloispermum caracasanum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
